column4: Again, if anyone knows if there is a process on official ubuntu distributions that archives new devices in /media as 7z archives, or if I'm rootkitted and need to do a clean installation...I'd greatly appreciate the input.
there may be some fuse fuse filesystem addons to auto compress files. but it may depend on exactly what you want to do
why would you think you are rootkitted?
theres irssi tutorials out there that detail how to do it. I use weechat these days myself..
btw thnx that was it
the whole /window thing
check out weechat some day. I perfer it 100x over irssi.
will do

also 'znc' works well with the console clients. :) I use znc on my linux box. and i irc to it.. it then bounces me here.. so i cen be connected with a dozen differnt irc clients.. and you just see me here once.
Ah, yeah, seen a couple of those.
Not sure of the relative benefits, but thnx anyways. :)
thnx
gnome shell is supposed to be very tweakable.. if you know javascript. i hear. ;)
Fantastic. The one language I don't really like all that much...

well I found the gnome-shell stuff ok, but I'm still hunting around for the configuration setting for gnome-terminal...would that be a gconf setting to enable emacs-style navigation in gnome-terminal, or has something changed with my bash?
not sure. see if it works in xterm, rxvt, terminator, xfterm or others how you expect.
it could be compiz/unity is grabbing the binding also,
does it work in the console correctly?
well...some of them. ^k kills to the end of line still, ^y yanks, but M-d doesn't delete, it just prints a "d" where the cursor was. Same in xterm.
k thnx
and its vague. :)
Yeah, I apologize. I suppose I'm complimenting Ubuntu here; I don't know if there's a better place to do that.
#windows ? :)  nah..better not do that..
haha yeah of course why didn't I think of that. ;)
